page.title: 14THE SOUTH DOWNS
page.content: The South Downs are in Sussex and are chalk hills. They give a variety of things to do and are a pleasure to see. People climb to the top to enjoy various activities. Picnics are one of the main things. Most people just walk up there to see the views of Sussex. Some people go up there to sketch the views of hills. People usually take their hobbies such as scrambling on bikes or sledging and skiing in winter when the South Downs are covered in a white icing. Many schools go up there to do their cross country. Many clubs go up there to do horse riding and hang gliding. Kite flying is again a popular hobby for parents and children. Not only do the people go up there but birds enjoy it as well. Rabbits are multiplying again and traditional flowers such as the wild orchid and cowslip are returning.
